articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Statue Erected in Samjiyon County
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Statue Erected in Samjiyon County
Samjiyon, September 23 (KCNA) -- The statue of leader Kim Jong Il was unveiled in Samjiyon County with due ceremony on Friday.
					 Present at the unveiling ceremony were Hwang Pyong So, Choe Ryong Hae, Kim Ki Nam, officials concerned, officials of the units which made contributions to erecting the statue, those of merits, shock brigade members, and working people, youth and students and service personnel in Ryanggang Province and the county.
					
					 The statue of Kim Jong Il was unveiled by senior officials of the Party and army and the county.
					
					 A floral basket in the name of supreme leader Kim Jong Un was laid before the statue.
					
					 Also laid there were a floral basket in the joint name of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, the State Affairs Commission of the DPRK, the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK and the Cabinet of the DPRK, floral basket in the name of the people of Samjiyon County and floral baskets in the names of the Party and power bodies, working people's organizations, institutions, industrial establishments and farms, units of the Korean People's Army and the Korean People's Internal Security Forces in the province and the county.
					
					 The participants paid high tribute to Kim Jong Il.
					
					 Choe Ryong Hae, member of the Presidium of the Political Bureau and vice-chairman of the C.C., the WPK, said in his address that the erection of the statue of Kim Jong Il in the time-honored place of the revolution in the most respectful manner was the precious fruition of the wise leadership of Kim Jong Un who is opening a new history of the cause of immortalizing the great leaders in this land.
					
					 The speaker called upon all the people to hold Kim Jong Il in high esteem as the eternal leader of the WPK and the people and bring earlier the final victory of the revolutionary cause of Juche, true to the leadership of Kim Jong Un.

articles.title: DPRK Cabinet Gives Reception for Participants in Film Festival
articles.content:
DPRK Cabinet Gives Reception for Participants in Film Festival
Pyongyang, September 23 (KCNA) -- The DPRK Cabinet hosted a reception at the People's Palace of Culture Friday in honor of the participants in the 15th Pyongyang International Film Festival in connection with its successful close.
					 Present there on invitation were foreign delegations and delegates and members of the international jury who took part in the film festival.
					
					 Among those present there were Ri Ryong Nam, vice-premier of the Cabinet, Pak Chun Nam, minister of Culture who doubles as chairman of the festival organizing committee, Cha Hui Rim, chairman of the Pyongyang City People's Committee, Kim In Bom, vice-minister of Culture and concurrently director of the Film General Bureau, and officials concerned.

articles.title: Letter to Kim Jong Un from Participants in Int'l Film Festival
articles.content:
Letter to Kim Jong Un from Participants in Int'l Film Festival
Pyongyang, September 23 (KCNA) -- Supreme leader Kim Jong Un received a letter from the participants in the 15th Pyongyang International Film Festival on Friday.
					 The letter said the film festival held in Pyongyang made a big contribution to strengthening the friendly ties among movie-persons of different countries desirous of a new just and peaceful world and marked a significant occasion in powerfully spurring the development of national films in many countries. 
					
					 Brief as their stay in Pyongyang was, they witnessed for ourselves the eye-opening realities in the DPRK in which epoch-making leaping advances have been made to startle the world under the wise leadership of the Workers' Party of Korea and keenly realized what inexhaustible strength the Korean people single-mindedly united around Marshal Kim Jong Un have, the letter said.
					
					 It expressed the firm belief that the heroic struggle of the Korean people to build a socialist power in which people's dreams and ideals are coming true would surely emerge victorious thanks to Marshal Kim Jong Un.
					
					 They will make contributions to achieving social progress and changes common to mankind against all sorts of subjugation and inequality by dint of great might of movie-art and produce good films reflecting the ideal of independence, peace and friendship in the future, too, and thus take an active part in the Pyongyang International Film Festival, it added.

articles.title: 15th Pyongyang Int'l Film Festival Closed
articles.content:
15th Pyongyang Int'l Film Festival Closed
Pyongyang, September 23 (KCNA) -- The 15th Pyongyang International Film Festival closed with due ceremony at the Central Youth Hall on Friday.
					 Present at the ceremony were Yang Hyong Sop, vice-president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly, Vice-Premier Ri Ryong Nam, Pak Chun Nam, minister of Culture who is chairman of the organizing committee of the festival, Cha Hui Rim, chairman of the Pyongyang City People's Committee, Kim In Bom, vice-minister of Culture and concurrently director of the Film General Bureau, and officials concerned.
					
					 Also present were delegations and delegates participating in the festival and members of the international jury.
					
					 Present there on invitation were diplomatic envoys of various countries and representatives of international organizations here and their spouses, military attaches and officials in charge of cultural relations of foreign embassies here and other foreign guests.
					
					 Introduced at the ceremony were films presented to the festival.
					
					 The jury announced the results and prizes were awarded. 
					
					 A letter to supreme leader Kim Jong Un presented by the participants in the festival was adopted at the ceremony.
					
					 Pak Chun Nam made a closing address.

articles.title: Delegation of All-China Journalists Association Leaves
articles.content:
Delegation of All-China Journalists Association Leaves
Pyongyang, September 23 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the All-China Journalists Association led by Zhang Yanping, president of the Beijing Youth Daily, left here Friday.

articles.title: DPRK Premier Inspects Nampho and Wonsan Ports
articles.content:
DPRK Premier Inspects Nampho and Wonsan Ports
Pyongyang, September 23 (KCNA) -- DPRK Premier Pak Pong Ju made field surveys of Nampho and Wonsan Ports alive with the drive for transporting materials needed for recovering from the flood damage in the northern part of North Hamgyong Province.
					 He looked round harbor facilities and cargo ships at the ports to learn in detail about the loading of cement. Then he held consultative meetings. 
					
					 The meetings discussed measures to fully ensure the safe sailing of cargo ships and cut down the time for loading and discharging cargo.
					
					 They stressed the need for the relevant units to mobilize and concentrate all forces and means on transporting materials for rehabilitation operations and enhance the responsibility and role of the crewmen of the ships. 
					
					 Meanwhile, the premier took measures to boost materials transport for the operations to recover from flood damage in the northern area by minutely organizing the transport in the field of railway transport.

articles.title: 16th May 21 Architectural Festival Closes
articles.content:
16th May 21 Architectural Festival Closes
Pyongyang, September 23 (KCNA) -- The 16th May 21 Architectural Festival closed with due ceremony at the Sci-Tech Complex Friday.
					 During the festival the participants exchanged successes and experience gained in the work to build more monumental structures and put the nation's architectural science and technology on the highest level.
					
					 The architecture layouts reflecting the daily developing architectural designs drew attention of the participants for putting formative art in architecture at a high level.
					
					 Building goods and utensils and tools made by with our natural resources and techniques were estimated. Construction designing programs and multi-medium were highly appreciated at the festival.
					
					 Present there were Vice-Premier Kim Tok Hun, officials concerned, officials, architects and technicians in the field of construction and teachers and researchers of science and education institutions.

articles.title: Int'l Academic Symposium to Be Held
articles.content:
Int'l Academic Symposium to Be Held
Pyongyang, September 23 (KCNA) -- An international academic symposium marking the 70th anniversary of Kim Il Sung University will be held on Sept. 29 and 30.
					 Prestigious educators and scientists of the DPRK and different countries of the world are expected to take part in the symposium to be held on the theme "Scientific development and social progress".
					
					 It will hear speeches on the successes made in various fields including socio-political science, economy and finance, literature, history, linguistics, mathematics, physics and life science.

articles.title: 43rd National Farm Machine Exhibition, Contrivers' Meeting Held
articles.content:
43rd National Farm Machine Exhibition, Contrivers' Meeting Held
Singye, September 23 (KCNA) -- The 43rd National Farm Machine Exhibition and contrivers' meeting took place in Singye County, North Hwanghae Province from September 20 to 22.
					 Taking part in the exhibition were farm machine factories, science and education fields and many other units. 
					
					 On display there were at least 240 farm machines, accessories and farm implements of more than 30 kinds.
					
					 There were judgment and estimation of such farm machines, accessories and farm implements as soil-managing machine, sowing and transplanting machine, manuring and cultivating machine and harvesting and threshing machines to be followed by their field test.
					
					 Pyongyang City took a special place in the exhibition.
					
					 The contrivers' meeting exchanged successes and experience gained in contriving, manufacturing and introducing farm machines and discussed the issues of generalizing them.

articles.title: Results from Recovery Efforts in DPRK
articles.content:
Results from Recovery Efforts in DPRK
Pyongyang, September 23 (KCNA) -- The flood-hit Musan Mining Complex in Musan County, North Hamgyong Province of the DPRK, has made a progress in the recovery efforts.
					 The Complex opened a temporary road for smooth transport of supplies and launched a vigorous work to restore all its production processes.
					
					 It removed huge amount of muck from workshops in a few days to run the operation of ore dressing process. And it finished a work to draw water from the site where the discharge conveyor was submerged.
					
					 Meanwhile, it restored destroyed or submerged excavator, rotary drill and other machines in ten days after the flood damage and carried out a project to supply power to main production processes.
					
					 As a result, the Complex, a leading quality iron-ore producer of the country, got ready to start its operation partially.

articles.title: Efforts Made for Normal Education in Flood-hit Areas
articles.content:
Efforts Made for Normal Education in Flood-hit Areas
Pyongyang, September 23 (KCNA) -- A progress has been made in the production of educational equipment and materials to be sent to flood-hit North Hamgyong Province in northern part of the DPRK.
					 According to Kim Song Il, department director of the Ministry of General Education, 206,000 textbooks and references of several hundred kinds and 10,000 experimental apparatuses and reagents were urgently transported to the disaster areas.
					
					 The recent stormy downpours left at least 50 schools and kindergartens in cities and counties of the province collapsed or largely damaged.
					
					 At present the ministry is concentrating its efforts on the work to provide more educational equipment and materials and school things without delay.
					
					 Meanwhile, it has encouraged educational officials and teachers in the efforts to restore the destroyed schools and ensure their normal operation in the disaster areas as soon as possible.

articles.title: Hop Production Increases in Ryanggang Province of DPRK
articles.content:
Hop Production Increases in Ryanggang Province of DPRK
Pyongyang, September 23 (KCNA) -- Hop picking is gaining momentum in Ryanggang Province of the DPRK.
					 This year the province has gathered hop 1.7 times higher than usual, thus opening up a bright prospect for surpassing the peak year in its production.
					
					 O Hyon Chol, manager of the Unhung Hop Farm, told KCNA that all the hop farms in the province are now concentrating efforts on the picking and processing of hop, showing higher production results.

articles.title: Moran Hill in Pyongyang Boasts of Historical Relics
articles.content:
Moran Hill in Pyongyang Boasts of Historical Relics
Pyongyang, September 23 (KCNA) -- On Moran Hill in Pyongyang, the capital city of the DPRK, there are a lot of historical relics showing distinguished wisdom and talents of the Korean nation.
					 Old buildings and remains of castle on the hill dating back to Koguryo Kingdom (B.C. 277-A.D. 668) have been preserved in their original state, under the Workers' Party of Korea's policy of preserving the nation's cultural heritage.
					
					 According to Kim Yong Chol, director of the Pyongyang City Management Office for the Preservation of National Heritage, President Kim Il Sung gave an important teaching in September 1946 as regards the preservation of historical sites and remains on Moran Hill.
					
					 But most of them were roughly destroyed or burnt out by indiscriminate bombing of the U.S. imperialists during the 1950-1953 Korean War. They were restored three years after the war, thanks to the state measure.
					
					 Later, such historical buildings as Ulmil, Choesung, Chongryu and Pubyok pavilions and Jongum, Hyonmu and Chilsong gates were mended several hundred times.
					
					 Artists and many other experts of the office have devoted their sincere efforts to preserving the historical sites and relics on the hill for decades.
					
					 The office conducts the colorful painting and other maintenance work for all the historical sites and relics on a scientific and normal basis and pays attention to educating visitors to the hill in the spirit of taking good care of the sites and relics, the director told KCNA.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Flays Park Geun Hye's Anti-DPRK Invectives
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Flays Park Geun Hye's Anti-DPRK Invectives
Pyongyang, September 23 (KCNA) -- Recently, the Park Geun Hye group of traitors is openly revealing their sinister intention to provoke the DPRK while pulling up it over its nuclear warhead explosion test for self-defense. She has gone reckless in the confrontation with the DPRK, crying out for "readiness to put an end to the north's regime."
					 Gangsters of the south Korean puppet military are reeling off a litany of such malignant vituperations as "scorched-earth operation against the north's leadership" and "operation to make Pyongyang disappear from map".
					
					 Rodong Sinmun Friday in a commentary likens them to tiger moths risking their lives.
					
					 Park has obviously become an incurable psychopath as she is working hard to provoke the DPRK demonstrating its invincible might as a nuclear power, the commentary notes, and goes on:
					
					 The army and people of the DPRK show no slightest mercy to the group of traitors challenging the inviolable dignity of the supreme leadership of the DPRK.
					
					 We are fully ready to blow up all bases of aggression and provocation anytime from any place.
					
					 The Park group is going more frantic in their moves for pressurizing the "north to dismantle its nukes" while dreaming of the "regime change in the north" but it will result in precipitating the change of the puppet regime in south Korea. Those traitors are fated to meet a miserable end.

articles.title: Minju Joson Flails Japanese Reactionaries for Suppressing Chongryon
articles.content:
Minju Joson Flails Japanese Reactionaries for Suppressing Chongryon
Pyongyang, September 23 (KCNA) -- Shortly ago, Japanese right-wing gangsters drove dozens of loudspeaker vans to the area around the Hall of the Central Standing Committee of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan (Chongryon) and went on the rampage over the DPRK's measures for bolstering its nuclear deterrence for self-defense, shouting "Expel Chongryon from Japan." Groups of several gangsters even attempted to break into the hall.
					 Commenting on this, Minju Joson Friday terms it hooliganism and an unpardonable and grave politically-motivated provocation against the DPRK and Chongryon.
					
					 Chongryon is a dignified overseas citizens organization of the DPRK, the commentary notes, and goes on:
					
					 Nevertheless, the Japanese reactionaries, far from making apology and reparation for their monstrous crimes in the past, are threatening the security and life of Koreans in Japan and working hard to crack down on Chongryon, the legitimate organization. This is a grave politically-motivated terrorism to tarnish the image of the DPRK and stamp out Chongryon at any cost.
					
					 What should not be overlooked is that the recent case was not a simple accidental case by a few right-wing gangsters but the case carefully premeditated and organized by the Japanese authorities in advance.
					
					 The DPRK will never remain a passive onlooker to the Japanese reactionaries' unreasonable suppression of Chongryon, and it will defend its legitimate position to the last and conduct more dynamic patriotic activities.
					
					 The Japanese reactionaries should bear in mind that such gangsterism will only invite a disgraceful ruin and stop at once the suppression of Chongryon.

articles.title: Kim Jong Suk's Brilliant Career Praised by Nigerian Social Organization
articles.content:
Kim Jong Suk's Brilliant Career Praised by Nigerian Social Organization
Pyongyang, September 23 (KCNA) -- The Nigerian National Committee for the Study of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism posted an article titled "Brilliant career of Kim Jong Suk" on its website on Sept. 19.
					 The article said:
					
					 After joining the Korean People's Revolutionary Army commanded by President Kim Il Sung in September 1935, Kim Jong Suk fought with a gun in her hand till Korea was liberated.
					
					 The President awarded her a gold ring in high recognition of the distinguished military exploits she performed in 1938 when the Korean People's Revolutionary Army was striking counterblows at the Japanese imperialists to cope with their spring offensive.
					
					 Kim Jong Suk protected the President from danger as a human bullet in a number of battle areas of the anti-Japanese war.
					
					 She resolutely defended the idea and line of the President.
					
					 The article also said that after being tasked by the President while looking after wounded and sickly guerrillas in 1939, she went to Chongbong Bivouacs, where she bitterly condemned the chief of the bivouacs for opposing the idea and line of the President.
					
					 She is immortal in the minds of the Korean people as the embodiment of the spirit of devotedly defending the leader, the article said.

articles.title: DPRK Introduced by Media of Singapore, Russia
articles.content:
DPRK Introduced by Media of Singapore, Russia
Pyongyang, September 23 (KCNA) -- The Singaporean paper Straits Times on Sept. 11 devoted two whole pages to a travelogue of a tourist who visited the DPRK.
					 The author of the article said that there were hardly any expectations that one can see the true picture of the DPRK known for "deterrence" and "isolation". It went on:
					
					 But very impressive was the daily life of people in this country I witnessed during my visit to it.
					
					 A member of the Children's Union took the hand of a grandmother at a zebra crossing and helped her cross the road safely and bowed to her, and young men and women danced with joy at Kim Il Sung Square, the plaza of the Arch of Triumph and other places, very interesting scenes.
					
					 The tourist described in detail about his impressions of going round the Pyongyang Metro and streets, and continued:
					
					 During the last period of my visit to the DPRK I visited Panmunjom.
					
					 A soldier of the Korean People's Army whom I met there said that if the U.S. ignites another war of aggression, the KPA will wipe out all the aggressors to the last one so that there would be no one left to sign a surrender document.
					
					 Through my visit to the DPRK I witnessed the modest and truthful Koreans.
					
					 The paper edited photos the tourist had taken.
					
					 Meanwhile, the Russian internet news Primorski Reporzor and internet paper Bremya Peremyon on Sept. 15 and 16 introduced monumental edifices wonderfully built thanks to the warm loving care of the mother party (the Workers' Party of Korea) including the Nature Museum, Masikryong Ski Resort, Mirim Riding Club and the Rungna People's Pleasure Park.

articles.title: U.S. Will Face Final Doom: Russian Paper
articles.content:
U.S. Will Face Final Doom: Russian Paper
Pyongyang, September 23 (KCNA) -- The Russian internet paper Bremya Peremyon on Sept. 15 carried an article titled "U.S. should draw lesson" exposing the U.S. history of aggression against Korea.
					 The article said: The monument to sinking of the USS aggression ship Sherman was erected on the bank of the River Taedong flowing across the center of Pyongyang, the ship that sank into the river when it intruded into Pyongyang in 1866.
					
					 The intrusion of the ship was a prelude to the U.S. invasion of Korea.
					
					 The U.S., far from drawing a lesson from the fate of the ship, encouraged the Japanese imperialists to invade Korea, not abandoning the ambition for aggression against Korea.
					
					 The U.S. signed the "Katsura-Taft agreement" which recognized Japan's colonial domination over Korea in 1905.
					
					 After the Japanese imperialists were defeated, the U.S. occupied south Korea, gravely violating the sovereignty of the Korean nation.
					
					 After it suffered a disgraceful defeat in the Korean War ignited by it, the U.S. has committed the moves for invading the DPRK.
					
					 Today the DPRK has a tremendous strength capable of coping with any war wanted by the U.S.
					
					 The U.S. has always been defeated in the confrontation with the DPRK.
					
					 If the U.S. ignites the second Korean war, it will face a final doom.

articles.title: DPRK Is Genuine People's Country: UK Body
articles.content:
DPRK Is Genuine People's Country: UK Body
Pyongyang, September 23 (KCNA) -- The British Association for the Study of Songun Policy posted an article titled "Genuine people's country" on its website on Sept. 15.
					 The genuine country of the entire Korean nation is the DPRK which has developed into a genuine people's state under the care of the peerlessly great persons of Mt. Paektu, the article said, and went on:
					
					 President Kim Il Sung, who gave the origin to the building of the people's power in the flames of the anti-Japanese war, united all patriotic forces of Korea with his broad magnanimity and generosity in so complicated period after the liberation of Korea, shattered the every move of the U.S. imperialists to divide Korea and founded the genuine people's state, the genuine country in which all Koreans live according to the general will of the entire Korean nation.
					
					 Under the wise guidance of the respected HE Kim Jong Un who is successfully translating the desire of the great President Kim Il Sung and HE Kim Jong Il into a reality, the DPRK has worked miracles, the first of its kind in the national history spanning five thousand years, in a short span of time while resolutely meeting all challenges of the enemies.
					
					 As the genuine life and bright future of all the Koreans in the north, the south and abroad are guaranteed by HE Kim Jong Un, they call his care the genuine people's country and cradle of life.

articles.title: U.S. Policy toward DPRK Goes Totally Bankrupt: Swiss Bodies
articles.content:
U.S. Policy toward DPRK Goes Totally Bankrupt: Swiss Bodies
Pyongyang, September 23 (KCNA) -- The Swiss Preparatory Committee for the 2017 Meeting Praising Great Persons of Mt. Paektu, the Switzerland-Korea Committee and the Swiss Group for the Study of the Juche Idea issued a joint statement on Sept. 14 denouncing the U.S. for going reckless, upset by the DPRK's successful nuclear warhead explosion test.
					 No sooner had the DPRK succeeded in the nuclear warhead explosion test than the U.S. president reeled off invectives, the statement said, and went on:
					
					 The test was part of the DPRK's practical countermeasures to cope with the nuclear war threat and sanctions by the U.S. and other hostile forces.
					
					 Lurking behind the "statement" announced by Obama before the expiration of his tenure is his real intention to evade the blame for pushing the DPRK to have access to nuclear weapons.
					
					 Obama is working hard to deny the strategic position of the DPRK as a full-fledged nuclear weapons state, a foolish act to eclipse the sun with his palm.
					
					 The DPRK is firmly taking hold on the line of simultaneously pushing forward the two fronts in order to protect its sovereignty, vital rights and peace from the ever-increasing U.S. nuclear threat and blackmail.
					
					 The recent test is only one process of implementing the above-said line.
					
					 The U.S. policy toward the DPRK goes totally bankrupt.
					
					 It should acknowledge the DPRK as a nuclear weapons state.

articles.title: DPRK Ranks Itself among Nuclear Powers: Indian Papers
articles.content:
DPRK Ranks Itself among Nuclear Powers: Indian Papers
Pyongyang, September 23 (KCNA) -- Indian papers carried articles on the 68th founding anniversary of the DPRK.
					 Rising Europe on Sept. 2 said in an article titled "Independent power":
					
					 The DPRK founded on Sept. 9, 1948 is demonstrating its might as an independent nuclear power.
					
					 How does small Korea have access to nukes and rank itself among nuclear powers with even H-bombs?
					
					 As the international community has already witnessed, the U.S. has steadily threatened the DPRK with nukes.
					
					 The U.S., not content with slapping all economic sanctions, blockade and military pressure on the DPRK for it differs from the former's ideology and social system and does not yield to the former's ambition for aggression, is going reckless to impose nuclear disaster on it.
					
					 What should the DPRK opt for under such situation?
					
					 It was the path of having access to one's own nukes.
					
					 It is the very legitimate right for the DPRK to have access to tremendous nuclear deterrence to cope with the moves of the U.S., the largest nuclear power in the world, and it is a just self-defensive measure no one can slander.
					
					 World's Mirror on Sept. 3 in an article titled "Songun and peace" said that the cause of a new war does not disappear due to the U.S. imperialists who keep their forces present in south Korea for more than seven decades. It went on:
					
					 The DPRK has ranked itself among the nuclear powers as it has access to nukes to counter the U.S. extreme nuclear threat and blackmail and attempt at aggression.
					
					 The solemn declaration of the DPRK that the right to preemptive nuclear strike is by no means a monopoly of the U.S. is startling the world.

articles.title: DPRK Introduced in Nepal
articles.content:
DPRK Introduced in Nepal
Pyongyang, September 23 (KCNA) -- The Nepali Literary Forum for the Study of Songun Politics hosted a lecture on the theme of "Reality of the DPRK" on Sept. 16.
					 Recalling that a delegation of the Forum visited the DPRK on the 68th founding anniversary of the DPRK, Chairman of the Forum Sonkori Baroti said:
					
					 During the visit we saw the reality of the DPRK with our own eyes.
					
					 We find that the imperialists' propaganda against the DPRK is devoid of authenticity and ground.
					
					 The DPRK is making dynamic progress for the prosperity of the country and happiness of the people despite the vicious sanctions of the imperialist reactionaries.
					
					 Pyongyang is, indeed, a beautiful city where modern streets such as Mirae Scientists Street have been built for the popular masses.
					
					 Many foreigners praise the DPRK as the unique heaven on the earth where popular policies are consistently enforced such no tax system, free education system and free medical care system.
					
					 All these are attributable to the love-the-people politics of the respected Marshal Kim Jong Un who is carrying forward the idea and cause of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 The DPRK's bolstering up the nuclear force is essential for protecting the dignity and sovereignty of the country from invasion by the U.S.-led imperialist allied forces.
					
					 The Korean people united single-mindedly around Kim Jong Un will surely achieve the final victory in the building of a socialist power under his wise leadership.

articles.title: Levantada estatua de bronce de Kim Jong Il en distrito de Samjiyon
articles.content:
Levantada estatua de bronce de Kim Jong Il en distrito de Samjiyon
Samjiyon, 23 de septiembre (ACNC) -- Fue construida con solemnidad una estatua de bronce del Dirigente Kim Jong Il en el distrito de Samjiyon.
					La ceremonia de desvelo tuvo lugar el dia 23 con la participacion de Hwang Pyong So, Choe Ryong Hae, Kim Ki Nam y otros cuadros, los funcionarios de la provincia de Ryanggang y el distrito de Samjiyon y de ramas interesadas, los otros de las unidades contribuyentes a la edificacion de la estatua, los ameritados, los miembros de la brigada de construccion, los trabajadores, jovenes y estudiantes y los oficiales y soldados del Ejercito Popular de Corea.
					
					Los cuadros directivos del partido, el ejercito y el distrito develaron la estatua.
					
					Al pie de la estatua fue depositado un cesto de flores a nombre del Presidente Kim Jong Un.
					
					Tambien, fueron colocados el cesto de flores a nombre comun del Comite Central del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, el Comite de Estado, el Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema y el Consejo de Ministros, de la RPDC, el otro a nombre de los habitantes del distrito de Samjiyon, asi como los ofrecidos por los organos del partido y el poder, entidades de masas, instituciones, empresas, fabricas y granjas de la provincia y el distrito y las unidades del Ejercito Popular de Corea y del Ejercito de Seguridad Interior del Pueblo de Corea, etc.
					
					Los participantes rindieron homenaje al Dirigente.
					
					Al pronunciar el discurso de la ocasion, Choe Ryong Hae, miembro del Presidium del Buro Politico y vicepresidente del CC del PTC, dijo que la edificacion en maximo nivel de la estatua de bronce del Dirigente en Samjiyon, lugar sagrado de la revolucion coreana, es un fruto de la sabia direccion del Presidente Kim Jong Un quien escribe una nueva historia de la causa de eternidad del lider.
					
					Exhorto a todos a enaltecer al Dirigente como eterno lider del PTC y del pueblo coreano y a luchar con dinamismo por adelantar la victoria final de la causa revolucionaria del Juche bajo la guia del Presidente Kim Jong Un.

articles.title: Premier coreano recorre Puertos de Nampho y Wonsan
articles.content:
Premier coreano recorre Puertos de Nampho y Wonsan
Pyongyang, 23 de septiembre (ACNC) -- El primer ministro del Consejo de Ministros de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Pak Pong Ju, recorrio los Puertos de Nampho y de Wonsan, donde se activa la campana de transporte de materiales necesarios a la recuperacion de las zonas septentrionales atacadas por las inundaciones de la provincia de Hamgyong del Norte.
					El premier dio una vuelta por las instalaciones portuarias, los cargueros y otros lugares, se entero en detalles del estado de embarcacion de cemento y organizo las reuniones consultivas.
					
					En las ocasiones se debatieron las medidas para garantizar la navegacion segura de los cargueros y reducir el tiempo de cargo y descargo y se destaco la necesidad de que las unidades relacionadas deben movilizar y concentrar todas las fuerzas y todos los medios en el transporte de materiales de socorro y que los tripulantes de cargueros deben elevar su responsabilidad y papel.
					
					Por otra parte, Pak tomo unas medidas para esmerarse en la organizacion y mando de transporte ferroviario a fin de aumentar la cantidad de transporte de los materiales necesarios a la reparacion de los danos en la parte septentrional del pais.

articles.title: Clausurado XV Festival Internacional de Cine de Pyongyang
articles.content:
Clausurado XV Festival Internacional de Cine de Pyongyang
Pyongyang, 23 de septiembre (ACNC) -- Tuvo lugar el dia 23 en la Casa Central de la Juventud la ceremonia de clausura del XV Festival Internacional de Cine de Pyongyang. 
					Asistieron a la ocasion Yang Hyong Sop, vicepresidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema, el vicepremier Ri Ryong Nam, Pak Chun Nam, ministro de Cultura y presidente del comite organizador del festival, Cha Hui Rim, presidente del Comite Popular de la Ciudad de Pyongyang, Kim In Bom, viceministro de Cultura y director general de Pelicula, los funcionarios interesados, las delegaciones y delegados participantes en el festival y los miembros del jurado internacional. 
					
					Fueron invitados los matrimonios de los representantes diplomaticos y de organizaciones internacionales, los agregados militares y los funcionarios encargados de asuntos culturales de las embajadas de varios paises, acreditados en Corea, y otros huespedes extranjeros. 
					
					Hubo la presentacion de filmes presentados en el festival y se publico la decision del jurado, seguida de la premiacion. 
					
					Quedo aprobada una carta dirigida al Presidente Kim Jong Un por los participantes en el evento. 
					
					El discurso de clausura estuvo a cargo de Pak Chun Nam.

articles.title: Se amplian exitos en resarcimiento de los danos en el Complejo de Minas de Musan
articles.content:
Se amplian exitos en resarcimiento de los danos en el Complejo de Minas de Musan
Pyongyang, 23 de septiembre (ACNC) -- Se logran exitos en los trabajos para resarcir los danos sufridos por las inundaciones en el Complejo de Minas de Musan, enclavado en el distrito de Musan de la provincia de Hamgyong del Norte.
					El complejo abrio una carretera provisional desde la estacion ferroviaria de Sophungsan hacia el distrito de Munsan para asegurar con exito el transporte de los materiales de socorro y dinamiza la recuperacion de los procesos productivos. 
					
					Fueron eliminados en unos dias enormes cantidades de escombros acumulados en los talleres de trituracion basta y de tratamiento de escorias. En particular, la rama de enriquecimiento recupero sus proceso productivos antes que otros sectores.
					
					Un taller termino en un corto tiempo el bombeo de agua del lugar donde esta sumergida la cinta de evacuacion y mina sucursal al aire libre repararon al cabo de 10 dias despues de la calamidad natural el excavador y las perforadoras giratorias destruidos y anegados. 
					
					El dominio de aseguramiento de energia suministra suficientemente la electricidad necesaria a los procesos de produccion principales.
					
					Por su resultado, el complejo reinicio parcialmente la produccion de minerales de hierro.
					
					El Complejo de Minas de Musan es la gran empresa mineral al aire libre con abundantes minerales de hierro de alta ley.
